$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.p: Governor Cooper announced today, April 24, that all North Carolina schools will remain closed through the end of the school year. Instruction in UCPS will continue through remote learning until June 9. Click here to view the full statement.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.p: UCPS offers Dual Language Programs (DLI) at 17 schools
UCPS has 9 Leader in Me Schools - 2 schools earning 'Lighthouse School' status
$131 million in scholarships earned by the Class of 2019

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: UCPS provides 1,000+ 3D-printed protective gear and fabric face masks to Atrium Health Union

a.span: UCPS provides 1,000+ 3D-printed protective gear and fabric face masks to Atrium Health Union

div.p: On April 24, UCPS delivered more than 1,000 3D-printed protective gear items to Atrium Health Union. UCPS Career Readiness teachers spent the past two weeks making the items, which included 3D-printed headbands for face masks and shields, 3D-printed ear guards and fabric face masks.

a.title: Go to comments for UCPS provides 1,000+ 3D-printed protective gear and fabric face masks to Atrium Health Union

img.alt: Porter Ridge High Pirate Talk videos help teachers connect with students

a.span: Porter Ridge High Pirate Talk videos help teachers connect with students

div.p: Thanks to a new Pirate Talk video series hosted by Porter Ridge High teachers, you can now learn about new and interesting topics in five minutes or less. Since its launch, teachers have produced as many as 10 short videos about their passion projects and interests, ultimately hoping to expose the students to practical life skills, potential hobbies and more.

a.title: Go to comments for Porter Ridge High Pirate Talk videos help teachers connect with students

img.alt: Porter Ridge Middle teacher Celeste Myers sews and donates hundreds of protective face masks

a.span: Porter Ridge Middle teacher Celeste Myers sews and donates hundreds of protective face masks

div.p: Several weeks ago, Porter Ridge Middle teacher Celeste Myers learned of the nationwide shortage of protective masks for healthcare professionals. Instead of sitting idly by, she decided to pitch in and help.

a.title: Go to comments for Porter Ridge Middle teacher Celeste Myers sews and donates hundreds of protective face masks

img.alt: UCPS provides cloth face masks and 3D-printed protective gear to local healthcare professionals

a.span: UCPS provides cloth face masks and 3D-printed protective gear to local healthcare professionals

div.p: In an effort to support healthcare professionals during the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) pandemic, Union County Public Schools (UCPS) will provide much-needed protective gear to local medical workers.

a.title: Go to comments for UCPS provides cloth face masks and 3D-printed protective gear to local healthcare professionals

li.a: UCPS Tip Line and Say Something Anonymous Reporting System
Work in Union County Public Schools

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: UCPS continues to closely monitor information about the Coronavirus. Leadership staff is working to keep students and employees as safe as possible through prevention measures. For additional information click HERE.

a.title: Go to comments for Coronavirus Update

span.p: The UCPS 2020 Graduation Schedule is available. Click HERE to access the document.

a.title: Go to comments for 2020 Graduation Schedule

span.p: Want to be more connected to UCPS and support school/district initiatives? View our campaigns and consider supporting these initiatives through a donation. View our online Living Tree portal to access the campaigns.

a.title: Go to comments for Support School Initiatives

span.p: Union County offers several high-quality programs to prepare students for success in kindergarten and beyond.
If you are need of a Pre-K option for your child, visit the Pre-K webpage to identify the program that best fits your child's needs.

a.title: Go to comments for Pre-K registration is open

p.strong: How to Obtain an Official Copy of Your Transcript

span.p: Union County Public Schools offers a secure and convenient online way to request and receive a student's transcript. We do not accept faxes, e-mails or phone requests. To request a transcript electronically click, Online Student Records and Payment System. Upon completing the online request form, you will receive a confirmation e-mail when your request has been received. Once your request has been processed and mailed your payment will be processed and you will receive an e-mail confirmation and receipt.

a.title: Go to comments for Transcript Requests

span.a: Required Teacher Workday - Early College (No School for Students)
Last Day of School - Early College
Required Teacher Workday - Early College (No School for Students)
